entity.name: OrbitDB
entity.description:
OrbitDB is a serverless, distributed, peer-to-peer database. OrbitDB uses IPFS as its data storage and IPFS Pubsub to automatically sync databases with peers. Itâ€™s an eventually consistent database that uses CRDTs for conflict-free database merges making OrbitDB an excellent choice for decentralized apps (dApps), blockchain applications and offline-first web applications.

OrbitDB empowers developers to build applications which protect data ownership, ensure user privacy and resist censorship.

OrbitDB provides a crucial layer to the decentralized development stack, data storage. OrbitDB will drive the next generation of decentralized applications.

projects.name: Encryption
projects.description:
OrbitDB is incorporating encryption into its core functionality, allowing developers to encrypt data at both the individual record and entire database level.

Through a modular design, developers will be able to select the best encryption model for them application; some developers may opt for symmetric encryption for simplicity while others may require asymmetric encryption for records not intended for the creator. Some developers may require both, for example, when building a two-way chat system.

Encryption will allow OrbitDB to compete as a viable alternative to traditional, centralized database systems.

projects.name: Voyager - OrbitDB Pinning
projects.description:
Voyager is OrbitDB's pinning server.

Because of its peer-to-peer nature, OrbitDB cannot guarantee a user's database will always be available. In the case browser-based applications leveraging OrbitDB, as soon as the machine is offline, the data is no longer available until the machine returns to an online state.

Pinning allows databases to be replicated even if the source machine is offline. It also offers a great way to back up data, ensuring multiple copies but also guaranteeing the user owns and controls the source database.

projects.name: go-orbitdb - OrbitDB for Golang developers
projects.description:
Go is a modern programming language for building system-based applications such as command line utilities, networking and servers.

go-orbitdb will provide Go developers with the ability to integrate peer-to-peer, decentralized databases into their applications and synchronize databases deployed other OrbitDB systems.
